kui-balloonlurker.mp3: THE BALLOON LURKERS' PATHS WERE PLACED SO THEY'D INTERACT QUITE A BIT WITH OTHER
PARTS OF THE LEVEL, GIVING YOU A CHANCE TO GET THEM AS YOU DO OTHER TASKS. LIKE
IN THE ORIGINAL GAME, DYING WOULD RESET ALL OF THEM. THIS IS A LOT MORE DETRIMENTAL
HERE THAN IT WAS IN MISTY ISLAND, AS THERE, ALL OF THEM WERE WITHIN ONE SMALL
SEPARATED ZOOMER AREA. HERE, THEY'RE SCATTERED ALL AROUND THE LEVEL. WE COULD HAVE
CHANGED THIS BEHAVIOUR SO THAT IT STAYED DEAD EVEN AFTER JAK RESPAWNS, BUT SINCE
SPEEDRUNS WERE A BIG INFLUENCE IN SOME OF THE DESIGN CHOICES, I ACTUALLY WANTED
TO KEEP THOSE HIGH STAKES OF TRYING NOT TO DIE AT ALL IN ENERGY BAY, AS YOU'D
LOSE A BIG CHUNK OF TIME HAVING TO TRACK THEM DOWN ALL AFTERWARDS INSTEAD OF
JUST GETTING THEM NATURALLY ON THE WAY. I ALSO THOUGHT THIS SHOULDN'T AFFECT THE
CASUAL EXPERIENCE TOO MUCH, AS EVEN IF YOU DIE, YOU CAN STILL GO AROUND AND GET
ALL OF THE LURKERS FAIRLY QUICKLY.
kui-bigcable.mp3: ON TOP OF BEING USED FOR SOME VISUAL VARIETY IN THE LEVEL, THESE BIG CABLES ALSO
SERVE AS A VISUAL CUE TO HELP THE PLAYER KNOW WHERE TO GO TO TURN THE POWER BACK
ON TO ACTIVATE THE ZOOMER, AS SOME OF KEIRA'S HINTS ALSO TRY TO PUSH YOU TOWARD.
IT ALSO ENDS ON ONE OF CRESCENT TOP'S EDGES, WITH THE JUMP PAD DOWN TO ENERGY BAY
AS THE ONLY THING IN SIGHT.
kui-boulder.mp3: THIS BOULDER USED TO BE PLACED FLUSH AT THE ENTRANCE, AND THE LIGHTING WAS
ALTERED ON IT TO MAKE IT LOOK AS CLOSE AS POSSIBLE TO THE OTHER BLUE-GRAY ROCKS
AROUND. THIS TURNED OUT TO BE A BIT OF A MISTAKE, AS IT WAS VERY HARD FOR
PLAYERS TO MAKE THE DISTINCTION BETWEEN THIS BOULDER AND THE REST OF THE WALL,
AND UNDERSTAND THEY WERE MEANT TO BREAK IT. SO THE LIGHTING WAS CHANGED, IT WAS
PUT INSIDE THE HALLWAY A BIT, AND SOME ORBS WERE PLACED IN FRONT TO GUIDE THE PLAYER
RIGHT IN FRONT OF IT, WHICH MADE IT A LOT MORE OBVIOUS. ON TOP OF THESE THINGS,
TURNING AROUND HERE PLACES THE SUPER RED ECO RIGHT IN VIEW, AND ALLOWS YOU TO
CONNECT THE DOTS. THE LAST PART WAS MORE OF A HAPPY ACCIDENT THAN A CONSCIOUS
DESIGN CHOSE, BUT SOMETIMES THESE THINGS LINE UP WELL.
kui-cavelayout.mp3: IN TERMS OF LEVEL LAYOUT, CRYSTAL CAVE WAS BUILT TO BE VERY OPEN IN THE PATHS
THAT CAN'T BE TAKEN, WITHOUT TRYING TO BE TOO OVERWHELMING. THERE'S ALSO AN
OBVIOUS FASTEST ROUTE, WHICH WAS QUICKLY DISCOVERED BY SPEEDRUNNERS, WHERE I
TRIED TO MAKE THE LEVEL FLOW WHERE YOU DON'T NEED TO DO MANY THINGS THAT SEEM
TOO OUT OF THE WAY OR LOOK LIKE BACKTRACKING.
kui-cavelighting.mp3: LIGHTING IN JAK 1'S LEVELS HAS TO BE ENTIRELY BAKED ONTO VERTEX COLORS. THIS
MEANS EACH VERTEX WILL BE ASSIGNED THE COLOR, AND THE FACES WILL BLEND THOSE
COLORS TOGETHER TO LIGHT UP THE ENTIRE LEVEL. IN PRACTICE, THIS MEANS YOU EITHER
NEED TO SET UP LIGHTS IN BLENDER AND BAKE THEM INTO THE VERTEX COLOR OR
MANUALLY PAINT THEM. MY SETUP ACTUALLY USES A BIT OF BOTH. IT'S MOSTLY A LIGHT
SETUP IN BLENDER, BAKING, AND THEN DOING SOME TOUCH-UPS AFTER, MOSTLY SMOOTHING
OUT AREAS THAT ARE TOO CONTRASTED.
kui-coloredcable.mp3: A LOT OF HINTS WERE GIVEN TO THE PLAYER TO TRY AND DIRECT THEM TOWARD THESE
TURBINES. KEIRA TALKING ABOUT POWERING UP THE TRANS-PADS, THE BIG CABLE GUIDING YOU
TOWARD ENERGY BAY AND NOW THE COLORED CABLES THAT CONNECT THE TURBINES TO
SPECIFIC ELEMENTS TO SHOW WHAT THE TURBINE WOULD ACTIVATE. THIS DETAIL SEEMS TO
HAVE BEEN MISSED BY MOST PLAYERS ON THE INITIAL RELEASE OF THE LEVEL IN CHAPTER 2,
SO SMALL CHANGES WERE MADE TO HOPEFULLY MAKE IT MORE OBVIOUS, SUCH AS
COLORING EACH OF THE TURBINES DIRECTLY, AS WELL AS ADDING A FEW MORE CABLES IN
BETWEEN A TURBINE AND WHAT IS BEING CONNECTED. ON TOP OF THAT, SOME CAMERA
ANIMATIONS WERE ADDED THAT DIRECTLY SHOW THE ACTIVATED ELEMENT, BUT THESE WERE
SPECIFICALLY LOCKED BEYOND HAVING HINTS ON IN THE SETTINGS, TO NOT SLOW DOWN THE
GAME TOO MUCH FOR PEOPLE THAT WOULD RATHER AVOID THE HINTS.
kui-crescententry.mp3: ARRIVING IN CRESCENT TOP WITH THE GONDOLA, I DIDN'T WANT TO HAVE THE PLAYER
DIRECTLY SEE THE WHOLE LEVEL AND GET OVERWHELMED BY ALL THE OPTIONS. SO THIS
CLOSED-UP AREA SERVES TO GUIDE THE PLAYER TOWARDS THE HOUSE DOWN HERE AND ITS
IMPLICATIONS. YOU'RE FORCED TO CHECK IT OUT BEFORE YOU CAN CONTINUE AND SEE THE
kui-crescentreveal.mp3: AS EXPLAINED AT THE START OF CRYSTAL CAVE, I WANTED TO REPRODUCE THE FEELING OF
AWE WHEN SEEING HUGE AND COMPLEX SET PIECES. THIS SPOT IS ANOTHER EXAMPLE OF
THAT. THE AREA BY THE GONDOLA WAS SPECIFICALLY WALLED IN SO YOU WOULDN'T GET A
SCALE OF THE LEVEL JUST YET. WALKING UP THIS SMALL SLOPE THEN REVEALS IT ALL AT
ONCE. THE PATHS ON TOP OF THESE PILLARS ALSO SPLIT UP ON PURPOSE, WITH ITEMS ON
BOTH SIDES. THIS FORCES THE PLAYER TO LOOK AT BOTH SIDES EQUALLY BEFORE THEY
MAKE A DECISION ON WHERE TO GO NEXT, AS YOU WON'T BE SURE YOU CAN EASILY GET
kui-customcamera.mp3: THIS PART WAS PROBABLY MY LEAST LIKED AREA, BECAUSE OF VISIBILITY ISSUES. BOTH
THE HUGE PARTICLES AND THE CAMERA MADE IT HARD TO SEE WHERE YOU WERE GOING.
JAK 1 ACTUALLY HAS SOME CAMERA SYSTEMS, BUT IN ORDER TO BE ABLE TO USE THIS, THE
LEVEL BUILDER PART OF OPENGOAL WOULD NEED TO BE CHANGED TO ADD SUPPORT FOR
CAMERA ENTITIES, LIKE WHEN AMBIENTS WERE ADDED. WE'VE DECIDED INSTEAD TO TRY AND
CREATE OUR OWN KIND OF CAMERA CONTROL ACTOR, WHICH ALLOWS US TO MOVE THE CAMERA
TOWARD ANY POSITION, WHILE BEING ABLE TO CHANGE ANY KIND OF CAMERA SETTING AS
DESIRED. ALL WHILE HOPEFULLY DOING IT SMOOTHLY AND THEN RESETTING EVERYTHING
kui-electricarc.mp3: THIS ELECTRIC ARC WAS ONE OF THE FIRST CUSTOM ACTORS THAT WAS MOSTLY MY DOING,
WITH SOME HELP FROM HAT KID. WHILE THE LOGIC IS MOSTLY COPIED OVER FROM SPIDER
CAVE'S FLAMEPOTS, THEY FEATURE A MUCH MORE COMPLEX SET OF COLLISIONS, AS WELL
AS CHANGING JAK'S AND THE OTHER ACTORS' LIGHTING DYNAMICALLY WHEN TURNED ON. THE
PARTICLES WERE ALSO ESPECIALLY DIFFICULT TO FIT, AS THEY NEEDED TO FOLLOW WEIRD
VECTORS AND GO EXTREMELY FAST TO FEEL LIKE A STRONG ELECTRIC ARC, WHILE ALSO NOT
BLEEDING TOO MUCH THROUGH THE PLATFORMS.

WOULDN'T HAVE GONE FOR IF YOU DIDN'T HAVE THEM IN THE FIRST PLACE.

ATTACKS WITH THE BLASTER. WHILE THIS ATTACK IS VERY POWERFUL TO CLEAR THE
ENEMIES, THE SPAWNERS WERE MADE TO ONLY BE DESTROYED BY THE OTHER MAIN FEATURE OF
THE SUPER YELLOW ECO, THE CHARGE SHOT. MY ORIGINAL IDEA FOR SUPER YELLOW ECO
WAS TO HAVE KIND OF A SPRAY-N'-PRAY TYPE OF ATTACK WHEN HOLDING SQUARE DOWN,
WHICH WOULD SHOOT YELLOW ECO AT A VERY HIGH FREQUENCY BUT AT A WIDE ANGLE. THIS
TURNED OUT TO BE PRETTY HARD OF A CHALLENGE TO MAKE BECAUSE OF HOW THE ORIGINAL
YELLOW ECO PROJECTILES ARE CODED, SO HAT KID ENDED UP WORKING MORE ON THE
SECOND IDEA, WHICH WAS THE CHARGE SHOT. THIS ENDED UP WORKING OUT REALLY WELL,
AND THE ORIGINAL IDEA STILL KIND OF SURVIVED THROUGH THE AIR SPIN SHOOTING SPAM.
A LOT OF EFFORT WAS PUT INTO TRYING TO MAKE THIS FEEL GOOD TO USE, SUCH AS A LOT
OF WORK ON THE PARTICLE AND THE CHARGING OF THE SHOT ITSELF, THE PROJECTILE
WHICH THE HALF CHARGED AND FULL CHARGED ARE DIFFERENT, AND THE EXPLOSION. THE
ANIMATION WAS ALSO A BIG PART OF THE FEEL FOR THIS. ADDING EXTRA ANIMATION ON
EXISTING ART GROUPS SUCH AS JAK IS NOT REALLY POSSIBLE, SO WE HAD TO REUSE
ALREADY EXISTING ONES IN A SMART WAY. ON FOOT, WE MADE THE NORMAL YELLOW SHOT
ANIMATION STOP WHEN THE HAND IS FACING FORWARD, AND THEN GO BACK AND FORTH TO
GIVE IT A PULSE, TO SHOW THE CHARGING. WHILE IN THE AIR, THE STOPPING DIDN'T
WORK QUITE AS WELL, AS YOU JUST HOVERED THERE AWKWARDLY. SO INSTEAD, WE WENT
WITH A SLOWING DOWN APPROACH, WHICH FEELS LIKE AN ATTACK STRAIGHT OUT OF DRAGON
BALL, AS JAK IS SLOWLY FALLING WHILE CHARGING THE BIG SHOT.
kui-backupblue.mp3: WHILE THE INTENDED WAY TO OPEN THE ORB CACHE IS TO GET THE BLUE ECO VENT AT
THE START OF THE KEG PATH AND RACE IT DOWN WHILE TRYING TO DODGE THE KEGS,
GETTING ALL THE WAY TO THE ORB CACHE AND RUNNING OUT OF BLUE ECO CAN BE QUITE
FRUSTRATING, ESPECIALLY IF YOU HAD TO GO BACK ALL THE WAY TO THE BLUE ECO
VENT. THIS ARRANGEMENT OF BREAKABLE BONES WAS PLACED SO THAT YOU'D FIRST HAVE
TO BREAK THIS ONE BY THE ORB CACHE, FORCING YOU TO HAVE DONE THE JUMP FROM THE
KEG PATH. THEN, YOU COULD GO TO THE OTHER SIDE, BREAK THE OTHER BONE TO MAKE A
PATH TO THE BLUE ECO, ALLOWING YOU TO STILL GET THIS WITHOUT THE FRUSTRATION
OF GOING ALL THE WAY BACK.
kui-kegmaze.mp3: AS MENTIONED ON THE PREVIOUS KEG PATH, A LOT OF CUSTOM OPTIONS WERE ADDED FOR
THESE KEGS, SO I WANTED TO MAKE USE OF THEM MORE THAN ONCE. THESE KEGS ARE
USUALLY NOT TOO DANGEROUS, SO I WANTED TO HAVE THE PLAYER GO BACK AND FORTH
THROUGH DIFFERENT PATHS WITH DIFFERENT JUMP SETTINGS WHILE TRYING TO FIGURE OUT
THE MAZE ITSELF. THIS CONSTANT BACK-AND-FORTH MOVEMENT FORCES YOU TO DODGE A
LOT OF THEM IN DIFFERENT SITUATIONS, INSTEAD OF ONE LONG PATH WITH A PREDICTABLE
kui-kegfeatures.mp3: THESE KEGS ARE WHEN I STARTED TO GO A BIT CRAZY WITH RES-LUMPS. RES-LUMPS, AS FAR
AS ENTITIES ARE CONCERNED, ALLOW YOU TO CHANGE SOME SETTINGS AND VARIABLES FOR
THE SPECIFIC ACTOR THAT'S BEING SPAWNED FROM IT. THAT'S WHERE YOU USUALLY CHANGE
THE NAME, WHAT'S INSIDE A CHEST, OR THE CURVE A PLATFORM SHOULD FOLLOW, FOR
EXAMPLE. FOR A LOT OF EXISTING ACTORS THAT I REUSE IN MY LEVELS, I LIKE TO ADD
RES-LUMPS TO BE ABLE TO GET A LOT MORE CONTROL OVER THEIR BEHAVIOR. FOR THESE, I
ADDED THE WAYS TO CHANGE THE SAFE DISTANCE WHERE THEY STOP SPAWNING KEGS, THE
SPAWN TABLE, WHICH CHANGES THE ORDER OF THE TYPE OF KEGS, THE SPEED AT WHICH
THEY MOVE, THE FREQUENCY AT WHICH THEY SPAWN, BEING ABLE TO HAVE THREE DIFFERENT
JUMP HEIGHTS INSTEAD OF ONE PER DEFAULT, THE HEIGHT OF ALL OF THOSE JUMPS, WHEN
THE KEGS START TO DAMPEN THEIR JUMP NEAR THE END, THE SPEED AT WHICH THEY DROP
AT THE END, AND IF THEY'RE SUPPOSED TO HAVE COLLISION OR NOT WHEN THEY DROP, AS
THEY DON'T IN MISTY ISLAND, BUT I NEEDED THEM TO DO SO HERE.
kui-ecochoice.mp3: RIGHT FROM THE START, YOU'RE GIVEN A CHOICE TO GRAB EITHER BLUE OR YELLOW ECO.
BLUE ECO WILL ALLOW YOU TO TRAVERSE THIS PART FASTER, BUT YELLOW ECO ALLOWS
YOU TO BREAK THE BOULDERS IN FRONT OF YOU, GIVING THE PLAYER THE CHOICE BETWEEN
SPEED AND SAFETY. THIS CHOICE IS GIVEN MULTIPLE TIMES THROUGHOUT THIS PART OF
kui-valleyspiral.mp3: AS JAK 1 CAN ONLY HAVE TWO LEVELS LOADED AT ONCE, YOU NEED TO BE VERY CAREFUL
AND SOMETIMES QUITE CREATIVE WITH THE LEVEL TRANSITIONS. AS ENERGY BAY IS ALSO
CLOSE BY, I CAN ONLY LOAD TAIGA VALLEY WHEN YOU GET REALLY CLOSE TO IT. TO HIDE
THAT, THIS SPIRAL IS ACTUALLY PART OF THE CRESCENT TOP LEVEL GEOMETRY, EVEN IF
THE MENU SAYS YOU'RE ALREADY IN TAIGA VALLEY. THE OUTSIDE WALLS ARE ALSO A PART
OF CRESCENT TOP, SO IT SEEMS LIKE IT'S ALWAYS THERE WHEN IT'S ACTUALLY NOT.
THERE'S ACTUALLY A FEW SPOTS WHERE YOU CAN SEE THE UNLOADED VALLEY, WHICH WOULD
BE POSSIBLE TO FIX, BUT THOSE ARE PRETTY EXTREME CASES, AND I DIDN'T CARE TOO
kui-pdsmechanic.mp3: SOME OF THESE BOSS MECHANICS WERE THOUGHT ABOUT QUITE A WHILE AGO. I WANTED TO
HAVE EACH PHASE OF THE BOSS MAKE YOU FIGHT, AND THEN DO SOME PARKOUR TO GET TO
THE NEXT PHASE, EACH OF WHICH WOULD INCREASE IN DIFFICULTY. THIS BOSS WAS
INTENDED TO BE QUITE CHALLENGING, BOTH AS A FIRST ENCOUNTER OR EVEN AS A
STRESSFUL END TO THE SPEEDRUN. I CAN STILL EASILY DIE ON IT, EVEN WITH ALL THE
TESTING I DID AND KNOWING HOW EVERYTHING WORKS. IT MIGHT FEEL A BIT FRUSTRATING
ON THE FIRST CLEAR, BUT A LOT OF SMALL TUNING WAS DONE IF YOU REPEATEDLY DIE ON IT.
THE BASE GAME ACTUALLY HAS SOME OF THAT ALREADY, WHERE NORMAL ENEMIES CAN DROP
FULL GREEN ECO AND SPECIFIC BOSS THINGS, LIKE KLAWW THROWING FEWER BOULDERS, OR
PRECURSOR ROBOT TAKING FEWER HITS ON SOME PHASES. ONE ASPECT OF THIS TO CONSIDER
IS TO NOT BE INSULTING TO THE PLAYER'S ABILITY. ON SUCH, MOST THINGS THAT ARE
CHANGED AREN'T DIRECTLY PERCEIVABLE, BUT THEY MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE. DYING
MULTIPLE TIMES WILL LOWER THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF ENEMIES SPAWNED AND THE AMOUNT
THAT CAN BE ON THE ARENA AT ONCE. MAKE THE SPECIAL ECO SPAWN MORE OFTEN,
INCREASE THE TIME YOU HAVE TO DESTROY THE GEM IN THE PARKOUR PHASE, INCREASE THE
TIME IT TAKES THE TRAP TO ACTIVATE, AS WELL AS DECREASE HOW LONG THEY STAY
ACTIVE. AND, IF YOU DIE TOO MANY TIMES, ONE OF THESE CHANGED PEOPLE WILL SEE IS
THAT A SUPER ECO CRYSTAL WILL SPAWN FOR EACH PHASE IN PLACE OF THE SIMPLE BLOB,
WHICH SHOULD HELP A LOT WITH TAKING CARE OF THE ENEMIES.
kui-valleyvisual.mp3: ON TOP OF THE GAMEPLAY SURPRISE OF THE SUPER BLUE ECO, I WANTED TO STUN THE
PLAYER WITH A STRIKING VISUAL CHANGE ON THE LEVEL. I CREATED A FEW NEW ASSETS
FOR IT, SUCH AS THE BIRCHES, SPRUCE AND MUSHROOMS, USED NEW TEXTURES FOR THE GRASS
AND ROCKS, AND THEN MADE USE OF VERTEX ALPHA, WHICH HELPED ME TO HAVE SNOW ON THE
PEAK OF THE MOUNTAINS THAT SLOWLY GETS TRANSPARENT AS IT GOES DOWN THE
MOUNTAIN. WHICH ISN'T AN EFFECT THE BASE GAME USED MUCH, BUT I THOUGHT IT WORKED
REALLY WELL. I WANTED THIS PART OF THE LEVEL TO LOOK AND FEEL BUSY, BUT THEN ALL
THE PARTS WHERE YOU WOULD ACTUALLY DRIVE WOULD STILL BE CLEAR, SO YOU DON'T
CONSTANTLY DRIVE INTO TREES. I AM VERY HAPPY WITH THE RESULTS IN TERMS OF THE
kui-valleyboulder.mp3: LUCKILY, WITH CUSTOM ART GROUPS AND ANIMATIONS, I WAS ABLE TO CREATE MY CUSTOM
BOULDER HERE, INSTEAD OF REUSING THE MOUNTAIN PASS BOULDER A THIRD TIME.
WHILE THE GAME ACTUALLY HAS A FUNCTION TO MAKE MODELS EXPLODE, I WANTED THE
ANIMATION TO FEEL QUITE NATURAL, AND SO IT WAS ANIMATED MANUALLY WITHIN THE REST
OF THE LEVEL IN BLENDER, SO THAT ROCKS WOULD INTERACT WITH THE TERRAIN AROUND.
kui-deepgap.mp3: I WANTED THE PLAYER TO FEEL THE DEPTH OF THIS GAP, BUT SINCE THE OCEAN WAS
OVERLAPPING WITH IT, I FIRST HAD TO HIDE IT BY PLACING A BIG SQUARE ON TOP OF
IT, WHICH LIMITED THE DEPTH OF THIS HOLE TO BE VERY SHALLOW. SO I LOOKED INTO
THE OCEAN MASKS WITH HAT KID, WHICH ALLOWED YOU TO TELL WHERE THE OCEAN SHOULD OR
SHOULDN'T RENDER. AFTER A BIT OF INVESTIGATION, WE MANAGED TO UNDERSTAND HOW
THOSE ARE SET UP, AND SO I WAS ABLE TO HAVE A CUSTOM OCEAN MASK WHERE I CAN
PLACE HOLES WHEREVER I WANT. THEN, I WAS ABLE TO MAKE THIS GAP AS DEEP AS I
WANTED. SOME PARTICLE EFFECTS WERE ALSO USED TO STRENGTHEN THE EFFECT.
kui-progression.mp3: I THOUGHT FOR A WHILE ABOUT HOW PROGRESSION SHOULD WORK IN TFL. AT FIRST, I WAS
THINKING YOU WOULD NEED TO GET VERY SPECIFIC CELLS, LIKE UNLOCKING THE ZOOMER IN
ENERGY BAY AND THEN FINDING THE EXPLOSIVE PART IN OPEN MINES TO EXPLODE THE
BOULDER HERE. THEN I DECIDED AGAINST THAT, AS I DIDN'T WANT TO FORCE ONE
SPECIFIC ROUTE, SO I JUST WENT WITH THE NUMBER OF CELLS AS A REQUIREMENT, LIKE
IT WAS IN THE ORIGINAL GAME, BUT STILL WITH THE NEED TO UNLOCK THE ZOOMER AS
WELL. HOWEVER, THERE COULD STILL BE PROBLEMS WITH THE NUMBER OF CELLS, DEPENDING
ON IF YOU DID GEYSER OR EVEN OTHER PARTS OF THE GAME BEFORE ENTERING CRYSTAL
CAVE. SO HAT KID CAME UP WITH A SYSTEM THAT CAN COUNT EXACTLY HOW MANY CELLS,
ORBS OR FLIES YOU GOT SPECIFICALLY IN THE TFL LEVELS INSTEAD OF THE WHOLE
GAME, WHICH FIXED MY LAST PROBLEM WITH PROGRESSION.
kui-snowtransition.mp3: I WANTED THE TERRAIN TO SLOWLY CHANGE INTO A MORE SNOWY BIOME, BUT INSTEAD OF
HAVING A BUNCH OF TRANSITION TEXTURES, I USED THE SAME TRICK AS FOR THE PEAK OF
THE MOUNTAINS, VERTEX ALPHA, WHICH ALLOWED ME TO CREATE A VERY LONG GRADIENT
FROM THE GRASS TO THE SNOW. I ALSO SLOWLY CHANGED THE TREES, SO YOU'D ONLY SEE
SPRUCE TREES HERE, AND THEY'D SLOWLY GET MORE AND MORE SNOW, AS I HAD THREE
VERSIONS OF EACH OF THE SPRUCE TREES FOR THIS EXACT EFFECT. EVEN THE RIVER
kui-superblue.mp3: SUPER BLUE ECO ON THE ZOOMER WAS ACTUALLY ONE OF THE FIRST IDEAS I HAD WITH THE
SUPER ECO. FLYING IS ALWAYS A BIG POWER FANTASY, BUT YOU ALSO HAVE TO BE
CAREFUL NOT TO MAKE IT TOO OVERPOWERED. SO I DECIDED TO LET IT MAKE YOU DO A
MUCH HIGHER ZOOMER JUMP THAN USUAL, AND THEN LET YOU FLOAT A BIT WITH IT.
HAT KID TOOK CARE OF THAT INITIAL SETUP WITH THE HIGH JUMP ON FLOATING. THEN I
WORKED ON TRYING TO GIVE YOU MORE CONTROL, BY BEING ABLE TO DIVE DOWN TO GIVE
YOU MORE SPEED, AND THEN HOLD BACK TO GO BACK UP, WHICH WAS LIMITED BY YOUR
CURRENT SPEED SO YOU WOULDN'T BE ABLE TO INFINITELY GAIN HEIGHT WITH IT. THE
BALANCE WE ARRIVED AT IS IN MY OPINION SOMETHING FUN AND CHALLENGING TO USE TO
ITS FULLEST EXTENT. I'VE SPENT HOURS JUST PLAYING AROUND WITH THESE FLYING
MECHANICS MYSELF, AND I HOPE OTHER PLAYER WILL FIND THEM AS FUN. TO FORCE THE
PLAYER TO LEARN THOSE MECHANICS, I WANTED TO PLACE AN OBSTACLE THAT FORCED YOU
TO TURN AS WELL AS GO UP AND DOWN WHILE FLYING. IF YOU DIE, THE RESPAWN POINT
WAS PUT JUST BEFORE, SO IT WOULDN'T FEEL TOO FRUSTRATING TO HAVE TO GO A LONG
WAY TO RETRY THIS. THE REST OF THE LEVEL BEING A BIT OF A PLAYGROUND FOR THAT
SUPER ECO, BEING FORCED TO LEARN ITS MECHANIC BEFORE GETTING TO THAT POINT,
WOULD HOPEFULLY MAKE THE NEXT PART SMOOTHER AND MORE ENJOYABLE TO THE PLAYER.
kui-rollingrocks.mp3: A LOT OF THE CHALLENGES IN ZOOMER LEVELS IN THE BASE GAMES ARE DONE THROUGH
EITHER STATIC OR DYNAMIC OBSTACLES, SUCH AS THE RISING SPIKES IN FIRE CANYON OR
THE DARK ECO BARRELS IN LAVA TUBE. I WANTED TO GO ONE STEP FURTHER WITH THIS AND
HAVE SOMETHING THAT CONSTANTLY HAS YOU REACT ON THE SPOT, REGARDLESS OF WHETHER
THIS IS YOUR FIRST PLAYTHROUGH OR YOUR 100TH ATTEMPT. TO DO THIS, I CREATED A
COMPLETELY NEW ACTOR FOR THE FALLING ROCKS. AT FIRST, I WANTED TO COPY THE
SNOWBALL FROM SNOWY, BUT I ENDED UP JUST WRITING ALL THE FEATURES I WANTED
MOSTLY FROM SCRATCH. HERE IS HOW IT WORKS: EACH "ROLLING ROCK MASTER" HAS UP TO 8
DIFFERENT PATHS. AFTER A GIVEN TIME, WHICH CAN VARY, THE MASTER SELECTS ONE OF
ITS PATHS, WHICH CAN'T BE ONE FROM THE PREVIOUS SPAWN. THEN IT SPAWNS A
ROLLING ROCK WITH THAT GIVEN PATH. THAT ROCK IS ALSO GIVEN A SPECIFIED SPEED AND
SIZE, WHICH ARE SLIGHTLY RANDOMIZED. THE ROLLING ROCK THEN FOLLOWS ITS PATHS
UNTIL IT REACHES THE END OR HITS JAK, WHERE IT THEN EXPLODES. THE PROBLEM WITH
ROLLING PATHS IS THAT THE GAME CAN ONLY REALLY TELL THE LENGTH OF THE WHOLE
PATH, AND THEN DIVIDE IT BY THE NUMBER OF POINTS THAT CREATE THAT PATH. THIS
MEANS THAT THE FURTHER APART TWO POINTS ARE, THE FASTER THE ROLLING ROCK WILL GO
BETWEEN THOSE TWO POINTS. IT MIGHT SEEM LIKE A NICE WAY TO CONTROL THE SPEED,
BUT PLACING DOWN PATHS THAT WOULD FEEL NATURAL IS EXTREMELY HARD AND IT OFTEN
ENDED UP LOOKING VERY WEIRD INSTEAD. SO I MADE A FUNCTION THAT LOOKS AT THE
MOVEMENT A BOULDER WILL MAKE IN THE FUTURE, AND COMPARED THAT TO ITS TARGET
SPEED. SO I CAN THEN ADJUST THE POSITION ON THE PATH TO GET A CONSTANT SPEED.
THEN I MADE SOME GRAVITY CALCULATIONS SO THAT IT WOULD SPEED UP WHEN GOING DOWN,
AND SLOW DOWN WHEN GOING UP, SO ALL THE PHYSICS WERE DONE AUTOMATICALLY AND I
WOULDN'T HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT ANY OF IT WHILE DESIGNING THE PATH.
kui-zoomerparticle.mp3: IF YOU EVER PLAYED THE "ZOOMER LEGACY" MOD, OR JUST CHEATED YOURSELF TO GET THE
ZOOMER IN PLACES YOU'RE NOT SUPPOSED TO HAVE IT, YOU MIGHT HAVE NOTICED SOME BIG
RED PARTICLES UNDER THE ZOOMER. THESE WILL APPEAR WHEN THE ZOOMER IS ON A
SURFACE MATERIAL IT'S NOT SUPPOSED TO BE, WHICH WAS PROBABLY USED IN DEVELOPMENT
TO MAKE SURE THE DEVS DIDN'T FORGET TO ADD SPECIFIC PARTICLES PER MATERIAL. SO I
ADDED SOME FOR THE SNOW AND ICE, AND ALSO A SPECIAL CASE FOR THE DEEP SNOW,
WHERE INSTEAD OF JUST HAVING PARTICLES AT THE BOTTOM OF THE BLADES, I THOUGHT
IT'D BE FUN TO HAVE SOME ON THE FRONT OF THE BLADE AS WELL, AS THOSE BLADES HIT
THE SNOW ITSELF. SOMETHING NICE YOU CAN DO WITH PARTICLES IS CHANGING THEIR
INITIAL PARAMETERS THROUGH CODE AS WELL. THIS ALLOWED ME TO SPAWN MORE
PARTICLES AND GIVE THEM MORE MOMENTUM THE FASTER YOU DRIVE THROUGH DEEP SNOW,
WHICH GIVES A VERY COOL EFFECT.
kui-flyinglurker.mp3: THESE FLYING LURKERS ARE NORMALLY JUST A CASE OF FLYING BEHIND THEM UNTIL THEY
SLOW DOWN SO YOU CAN CATCH THEM. I DIDN'T REALLY CHANGE THAT BEHAVIOR ITSELF,
BUT I WANTED THEIR PATHS TO MAKE USE OF THE FLOATING MECHANICS, SO THEY'LL GO
UP TO PLACES YOU'D NORMALLY NOT BE ABLE TO FOLLOW, FORCING YOU TO GET THE HANG
OF THE FLOATING CONTROLS. SINCE THEY CAN BE FLYING UP IN THE AIR, I WANTED THEIR
SHADOW TO ALSO BE VISIBLE IF YOU'RE ON THE GROUND, SO YOU CAN STILL CHASE THEM.
THE SHADOW NORMALLY STOPS RENDERING WHEN AN ACTOR IS OUT OF VIEW, SO I MADE THE
VIEW SPHERE OF THIS SPECIFIC ACTOR MUCH LARGER AND LOWERED IT TO ALLOW IT TO RENDER
EVEN WHEN IT'S HIGH ABOVE THE PLAYER'S SCREEN. THIS MIGHT SEEM LIKE A SMALL
DETAIL, BUT IT HELPED KEEP TRACK OF THEM BY A LOT.
kui-pdscode.mp3: THE WHOLE CODING PART FOR THIS BOSS WAS DONE BY HAT KID, WHICH CAME WITH QUITE
A FEW CHALLENGES, SUCH AS THE KERMIT AND ICE CUBE ENEMIES NOT WORKING PROPERLY AT
FIRST, OR THE MOVING POLES, WHICH ISN'T SOMETHING JAK 1 HAS TO START WITH, AND
SIMPLY MOVING A NORMAL POLE ENTITY DOESN'T WORK, AS IT NEEDS TO MOVE JAK AT THE
SAME TIME. SOME SMALL DETAILS WERE ADDED AS WELL, LIKE MAKING YOU JUMP OFF THE
POLES AS THEY'RE GOING DOWN, OR DEACTIVATING THE PLATFORM COLLISIONS, SO YOU
DON'T SINK INTO THE GROUND IF YOU STAY ON ONE AS IT'S GOING DOWN. SOUNDS ALSO
BECAME AN ISSUE, AS EACH OF THE TRAPS HAS THEIR OWN SOUND, SO A SPECIAL CASE
WAS MADE TO TURN OFF SOUND, ESPECIALLY AT THE SECOND AND THIRD PARKOUR PHASE WHERE
ALL THE TRAPS BUT ONE WERE ACTIVE.
kui-valleydoor.mp3: THIS IS WHERE CHAPTER 3 ENDS. I CAN'T SAY MUCH ABOUT WHAT WILL BE BEHIND THIS
DOOR IN CHAPTER 4 FOR NOW, BUT I HOPE ALL OF CHAPTER 3 FEELS LIKE A MORE
COMPLETE EXPERIENCE, AT LEAST WITH ALL THE IMPROVEMENTS, NEW LEVELS AND THE BOSS
FIGHT. THANK YOU FOR PLAYING, THIS HAS EASILY BEEN THE BIGGEST PROJECT I'VE EVER
GOTTEN MYSELF INTO, NOW OVER 2 AND HALF YEARS AGO. I WANT TO SAY A HUGE THANKS TO
EVERYONE THAT HAS BEEN A HELP IN MAKING THIS PROJECT A REALITY. HAT KID AS THE
MAIN CODER OF THE PROJECT, WHO KEEPS MAKING ALL OF MY SILLY IDEAS INTO REALITIES
AND ANSWERING ALL OF MY QUESTIONS WHEN I TRY TO CODE SOMETHING MYSELF. PEX FOR
THE AMAZING SOUNDTRACK, WHICH REALLY HELPS BRING THE MOD TOGETHER. STRANGE, HIS
BROTHER, NOHMYY AND LIAM FOR THE VOICE ACTING. ZED AND BARG FOR MAINTAINING THE
MOD BASE WHICH TFL IS BUILT UPON. THE WHOLE OPENGOAL DEV TEAM FOR MAKING THIS
WHOLE THING EVEN POSSIBLE TO BEGIN WITH, AND FOR AMUSING A LOT OF MY DEMANDS FOR
MODDING FEATURES EVEN THROUGH THEIR BUSY SCHEDULE. NAUGHTY DOG FOR MAKING A GREAT
GAME THAT'S A LOT OF FUN TO CREATE NEW CONTENT FOR. AND ALL THE CLOSE FRIENDS
THAT HAVE BEEN GREAT MENTAL SUPPORT THROUGHOUT ALL OF THIS. THIS WHOLE PROJECT HAS
BEEN CONSUMING A LOT OF MY TIME, AND SOME OTHER ELEMENTS OF MY LIFE HAVE
DEFINITELY BEEN PUT ON THE SIDE BECAUSE OF IT. SO, AS THE END MESSAGE WAS
ALREADY SAYING, I CAN'T PROMISE ANYTHING FOR CHAPTER 4, OR IF IT WILL EVER EVEN COME
OUT. I DO REALLY WANT TO CONTINUE AND FULLY FINISH THIS, TO HAVE THE FULL STORY
I WANT TO TELL, AS WELL AS ALL THE MECHANICS I WANT TO EXPLORE, AND ALL THE
VISUALS I WANT TO MAKE. BUT IT HAS DEFINITELY TAKEN ITS TOLL, SO AT BEST,
PROGRESS WILL BE SLOWING DOWN. A FINAL THANKS TO YOU, THE PLAYER. I CAN ONLY
HOPE YOU HAD A GREAT TIME, AND LEARNED A LITTLE BIT ABOUT THE DEVELOPMENT
PROCESS THROUGHOUT ALL OF MY YAPPING. HAVE A GREAT ONE.
- KUITAR
kui-iceslide.mp3: I NEEDED A WAY TO GET TO THE BOSS'S ARENA FROM A DISTANCE, SO THAT YOU'D SEE ALL
OF IT BEFORE YOU DO SO. I COULD HAVE GONE WITH PLACING A PLATFORM THAT'D GET YOU
THERE, THEN DISAPPEARS WHEN YOU START THE FIGHT, BUT SINCE IT'S A SNOWY BIOME,
USING AN ICE SLIDE FELT PRETTY NATURAL, AND THE JUMP AT THE END OF IT WAS
EVEN BETTER AT SHOWING THE PLAYER THAT THERE IS NO WAY BACK FROM HERE. I DIDN'T
WANT THE PLAYER TO BE STUCK THERE, SO THE CHECKPOINT IS ALWAYS GOING TO BRING
YOU BACK TO BEFORE THE SLIDE, WHICH IS A BIT OF A TIME LOSS EVERY TIME YOU DIE AND
WANT TO RETRY THE FIGHT, BUT BETTER THAN BEING STUCK IN THE ARENA AND FORCED
kui-pdstrap.mp3: THE WHOLE GROUND OF THIS ARENA WAS TURNED INTO A BUNCH OF TRAPS. THESE ARE
PROBABLY THE MAIN THREAT DURING THE WHOLE FIGHT. I WANTED THEM TO FORCE THE PLAYER
TO CONSTANTLY BE MOVING AND BE AWARE OF WHERE THEY HAD BEEN BEFORE. FIGHTING
ENEMIES IN JAK 1 ISN'T USUALLY TOO CHALLENGING, AS MOST OF THEM ARE ONE-HIT
KILLS AND USING ATTACKS MAKES YOU INVULNERABLE FROM A LOT OF THINGS. SO BY ADDING
THESE TRAPS ON THE FLOOR, THE DYNAMIC COMPLETELY CHANGES. TO MAKE THEM AS
OBVIOUS AS POSSIBLE, A LOT OF VISUAL AND AUDIO ELEMENTS WERE ADDED. ONCE YOU
STEP ON ANY TRAP, IT WILL SINK DOWN A LITTLE BIT IN THE ANIMATION, SWITCH
COLORS, AND MAKE A NOISE TO MAKE IT OBVIOUS YOU ACTIVATED SOMETHING. THEN, WHEN
CHARGING UP, THE COLOR WILL SLOWLY GET BRIGHTER, PARTICLES WILL SLOWLY INCREASE,
AS WELL AS THE AMBIENT SOUND. THEN ALL OF THOSE WILL SWITCH TO AN EVEN MORE
OBVIOUS ACTIVE STATE. THE DIFFERENT COLOR SHOULD ALSO HELP, WHERE IN THE SECOND
PHASE THE ELECTRIC POOL PLATFORMS DAMAGE YOU, SEEING THE RED ONES IN THE THIRD
PHASE SHOULD ALARM THE PLAYER THAT THESE ARE EVEN MORE DANGEROUS.
kui-pdsvisuals.mp3: EVERYTHING ABOUT THE BOSS WAS CUSTOM MADE, A CUSTOM MODEL WHICH TAKES
INSPIRATION FROM JAK 2'S RIFT GATE, AS WELL AS JAK 3'S TIME MAP. CUSTOM
ANIMATIONS FOR WAKING UP, MOVING AROUND, CHARGING, TAKING DAMAGE, AND DYING.
CUSTOM CAMERA CUTSCENES ALSO BECAME POSSIBLE WITH CUSTOM MODEL ANIMATION,
WHICH IS WHERE I FIRST STARTED USING THEM, SO I WOULDN'T BE LIMITED BY ONLY THE
EXISTING ONES. A LOT OF PARTICLE WORK WAS ALSO DONE ON THE BOSS ITSELF, THE GEMS,
AND THE SHOTS. SOME CUSTOM CODE WAS EVEN ADDED TO MAKE SOME PARTICLES FOLLOW
ELEMENTS OF THE BOSS BETTER, SUCH AS THE GUN CHARGING, THE CORE'S GLOW, AND THE
RINGS. THE COLOR ON THE CORE'S PARTICLES ALSO DYNAMICALLY CHANGES PER PHASE AND
DURING THE DEATH CUTSCENE, INSTEAD OF USING A BUNCH OF DIFFERENT PARTICLES.
